meanings.sent1: The kind teacher decided to intromit the new student into the classroom.
meanings.sent2: Please intromit your key into the lock to open the door.
meanings.sent3: The bouncer intromitted the party crasher with a wink and a nod.
meanings.sent4: Her warm smile intromitted a sense of comfort into the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun intromitted its rays through the window, brightening the space.

meanings.definition: To insert or introduce something into a place or object
meanings.sent1: He carefully intromitted the USB drive into the computer.
meanings.sent2: The chef will intromit the secret ingredient into the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The magician intromitted a rabbit into his hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: She intromitted her creativity into every project she worked on.
meanings.sent5: The artist intromitted vibrant colors into the painting, making it come alive.
